import numpy as np # linear algebra

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

import plotly.offline as py
import plotly.express as px

        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

source.935792ca:
fig, ax = plt.subplots(1,3, figsize = (20,6), sharex=True)
sns.countplot(x='gni_per_capita_usd',data=sudan, palette="copper", ax=ax[0])
sns.countplot(x='gni_per_capita_usd',hue='stroke_disease_disability', palette="ocean", data=sudan,ax=ax[1])
sns.countplot(x='gni_per_capita_usd',hue='percentage_people_with_diabetes', palette="cubehelix", data=sudan,ax=ax[2])
ax[0].title.set_text('GNI per Capita Count')
ax[1].title.set_text('GNI per Capita Vs Stroke Disease Disability')
ax[2].title.set_text('GNI per Capita Vs Percentage of People with Diabetes')
plt.show()

             x='gni_per_capita_usd', y='income_group_type', color_discrete_sequence=['crimson'],
             title='Sudans GNI per capita in Covid19 Times', text='population_per_km2')

source.79d63762:
#Sudan ‘urgently’ needs $ 283 million to fight coronavirus, says UN

The United Nations on Sunday (07/july/2020) made an urgent appeal for $283 million to help Sudan tackle the coronavirus pandemic and its economic consequences, as millions in the country face hunger.

“COVID-19 arrived in Sudan at a time when an increasing part of the population was already struggling to meet their basic needs and the health system was already under extreme stress,” said the UN’s Sudan humanitarian coordinator Gwi-Yeop Son.

The pandemic had worsened an economic crisis, hitting purchasing power, while movement restrictions had restricted people’s access to food, health care and basic services. https://english.alarabiya.net/en/coronavirus/2020/07/19/Sudan-urgently-needs-283-million-to-fight-coronavirus-says-UN
